item.title: How Small Language Models Are Key to Scalable Agentic AI
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
The rise of agentic AI is transforming how businesses approach automation and productivity. ü§ñ Recent insights highlight the potential of small language models (SLMs) as efficient alternatives to large language models (LLMs) in agentic applications. SLMs can reduce costs and improve operational flexibility while maintaining performance. This shift enables enterprises to utilize SLMs for specific tasks, reserving LLMs for more complex scenarios. Tools like NVIDIA‚Äôs Nemotron demonstrate the‚Ä¶

Source: Nvidia Developer Blog
Author: Peter Belcak
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: The crawl-to-click gap: Cloudflare data on AI bots, training, and referrals
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
The landscape of internet traffic is changing dramatically due to AI. By mid-2025, AI training is driving nearly 80% of crawling activity, significantly impacting referral traffic to publishers. üìâ As search engines and AI crawlers consume vast amounts of data, real user engagement is declining. For example, Google‚Äôs referrals to news sites fell nearly 9% in March 2025 compared to January. Cloudflare data highlights this shift, showing a surge in crawling activity, yet a notable imbalance in‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Jo√£o Tom√©

item.title: Open-source is for the people, by the people
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting developments in the world of Python! Travis Oliphant, the creator of NumPy and SciPy, discusses the growth of Python as a data science tool and the significance of community in open-source projects. He highlights recent releases of NumPy 2.3.0 and SciPy 1.16.0, and introduces the OpenTeams Incubator, aimed at supporting sustainable open-source communities. üìä Connect with Travis for insights on open-source growth! #OpenSource #DataScience #Python #Community #Collaboration

Source: Stack Overflow Blog
Author: Phoebe Sajor
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: A deeper look at AI crawlers: breaking down traffic by purpose and industry
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåê Cloudflare Radar is enhancing AI insights with new industry-focused data on bot traffic. The article discusses how traditional search platforms are affected by the rise of AI. Users often find answers without clicking through to original sources, impacting ad revenue for publishers. New features include a breakdown of AI bot traffic by purpose, such as training and user action, allowing for better understanding of these trends. üìäü§ñ #AIBotTraffic #CloudflareRadar #DigitalMarketing‚Ä¶

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: David Belson
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: Uninterrupted Motion: Why Factories Need a New Class of Wireless
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Factories are increasingly using Automated Guided Vehicles (AGVs) and Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) to boost productivity. These vehicles rely on robust wireless networks to operate effectively. üìàü§ñ A reliable connection is vital for real-time inspections and safety alerts. Any interruption can lead to missed defects or safety risks, potentially halting production. üõë‚ö†Ô∏è Companies like BMW and Samsung are already utilizing these technologies to enhance quality assurance and operational safety‚Ä¶.

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Patricia Costa
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: The business impact of Elasticsearch logsdb index mode and TSDS
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ The Elasticsearch team has rolled out enhancements in versions 8.19 and 9.1, focusing on storage efficiency and performance. üìä Key features include the logsdb index mode and time series data streams (TSDS), which address challenges faced by DevOps and security teams. üìà Benchmark results show a storage efficiency improvement of ~16% and an indexing throughput boost of ~19%. For users not yet on logsdb, storage reductions could exceed 70%. üîç Remember, logsdb is available for both Basic and‚Ä¶

Source: Elastic Blog
Author: Tim Brophy
Category: industry_analysis
